	whether the registrant is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, a non-accelerated filer or a smaller reporting company. </FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="TBL5" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Large accelerated filer &#9744;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Accelerated filer &#9744;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Non-accelerated filer &#9744;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	(Do not check if smaller reporting company)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 50%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Smaller reporting company &#9745;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is a shell company (as defined in Rule 12b-2 of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	the Act).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Yes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&#9744;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;No&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&#9745;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	As of December
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	31, 2015, 12,434,887
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	shares of common stock were outstanding. The aggregate market value of the common stock held by non-affiliates of the registrant, as of December 31, 2015, the last business day of the second&nbsp;fiscal quarter, was approximately $25,394,00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	based on the average high and low price of&nbsp;$7.05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	for the registrant&rsquo;s common stock as quoted on NASDAQ Capital Market on that date. Shares of common stock held by each director, each officer and each person who owns 10% or more of the outstanding common stock have been excluded from this calculation in that such persons may be deemed to be affiliates. The determination of affiliate status is not necessarily conclusive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The registrant had&nbsp;12,400,758 shares of its
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	common stock outstanding as of September 16, 2016.
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Report&rdquo;) contains &ldquo;forward-looking statements&rdquo; within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &ldquo;Securities Act&rdquo;), and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &ldquo;Exchange Act&rdquo;). Forward-looking statements discuss matters that are not historical facts. Because they discuss future events or conditions, forward-looking statements may include words such as &ldquo;anticipate,&rdquo; &ldquo;believe,&rdquo; &ldquo;estimate,&rdquo; &ldquo;intend,&rdquo; &ldquo;could,&rdquo; &ldquo;should,&rdquo; &ldquo;would,&rdquo; &ldquo;may,&rdquo; &ldquo;seek,&rdquo; &ldquo;plan,&rdquo; &ldquo;might,&rdquo; &ldquo;will,&rdquo; &ldquo;expect,&rdquo; &ldquo;predict,&rdquo; &ldquo;project,&rdquo; &ldquo;forecast,&rdquo; &ldquo;potential,&rdquo; &ldquo;continue,&rdquo; negatives thereof or similar expressions. These forward-looking statements are found at various places throughout this Report and include information concerning possible or assumed future results of our operations; business strategies; future cash flows; financing plans; plans and objectives of management; any other statements regarding future operations, future cash needs, business plans and future financial results, and any other statements that are not historical facts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(255, 255, 255);">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	to the public.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any or all of the forward-looking statements included in this Report and in any other reports or public statements made by us are not guarantees of future performance and may turn out to be inaccurate. These forward-looking statements represent our intentions, plans, expectations, assumptions and beliefs about future events and are subject to risks, uncertainties and other factors.&nbsp;&nbsp;Many of those factors are outside of our control and could cause actual results to differ materially from the results expressed or implied by those forward-looking statements. In light of these risks, uncertainties and assumptions, the events described in the forward-looking statements might not occur or might occur to a different extent or at a different time than we have described. You are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date of this Report. All subsequent written and oral forward-looking statements concerning other matters addressed in this Report and attributable to us or any person acting on our behalf are expressly qualified in their entirety by the cautionary statements contained or referred to in this Report.
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

</P>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	PART I
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Item 1.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Business
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM Software Group, Inc. (&ldquo;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM,&rdquo; &quot;the Company,&quot; &ldquo;we,&rdquo; &ldquo;our,&rdquo; or &ldquo;us&rdquo;) is a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;leading provider of cloud-based business and on premise management solutions for the auto parts, tires and vertical distribution industries.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;We have a broad line of software solutions and services to address the information technology (&quot;IT&quot;) needs of virtually every significant sector of the automotive aftermarket in the United Kingdom (&quot;UK&quot;) and Ireland (collectively referred to as the &ldquo;UK Market&rdquo;) and North America (&ldquo;NA&rdquo;), which includes the United States (&quot;US&quot;) and Canada,&nbsp;and are seeking to leverage this position into new industry verticals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Our Markets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM provides software, information and related services to businesses engaged in the automotive aftermarket in the US
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	, Canada,&nbsp;UK and Ireland. The automotive aftermarket consists of businesses associated with the life cycle of a motor vehicle from when the original manufacturer&rsquo;s warranty expires to when the vehicle is scrapped. Products sold by businesses engaged in this market include the parts, tires and auto services required to maintain and improve the performance or appeal of a vehicle throughout its useful life.&nbsp;We aim to meet the business needs of customers who are involved in the maintenance and repair of automobiles and light trucks in three key segments of the automotive aftermarket, namely parts, tires and auto service. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;customer base consists of wholesale parts and tire distributors, retailers, franchisees, cooperatives, auto service chains and single location auto service businesses with high customer service expectations and complex commercial relationships.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	In the&nbsp;UK Market, we also provide management solutions to businesses involved in the wholesale of constru
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	ction materials. These vertical markets include plumbing, building, lumber, and electrical wholesale distribution companies.&nbsp; We currently do not provide management solutions for vertical markets in North America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Industry Overview
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM
</FONT>
	serves the business needs of customers involved in the supply of parts, maintenance and repair of automobiles and light trucks in three key segments of the automotive aftermarket, namely parts, tires and auto service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The industry is presently experiencing a level of consolidation in the lines that are being sold. The previous distinction of having parts and tires provided by two distinct suppliers is coming to an end, as our customers
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&rsquo; businesses need to offer their clients the widest range of products and services under one roof. As a result, what were previously parts-only stores, jobbers and warehouse, are now taking in tire inventory as well in order to satisfy their clients&rsquo; demands, and vice-versa. This in turn is causing owners of these businesses to evaluate their business systems to ensure they can compete over the short, medium and long term. An increase in the &ldquo;do-it-yourself&rdquo; market due to the &ldquo;credit crunch&rdquo; is requiring these systems, but at the same time a need to compete strongly with other parts stores is cutting margins as businesses attempt to attract new and return business. Longer warranties are still deferring the length of time until newer vehicles are entering the aftermarket, except for running spares and service parts, accident damage, and optional add-ons such as security, entertainment, performance and customization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Continuing market conditions related to the overall down
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	turn in the consumer market are also directly affecting the confidence and ability of businesses to invest in new systems. The industry&rsquo;s response to this has been to introduce incentive and discount programs, but to date it is uncertain whether this approach will be successful long term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Nonetheless, we&nbsp;believe that the automotive aftermarket will continue&nbsp;to&nbsp;grow,&nbsp;driven by the following factors:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="TBL254" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 84.6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	gradual growth in the aggregate number of vehicles in use;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="TBL255" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 84.6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	an increase in the average age of vehicles in operation, now estimated to be 11.5 years;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="TBL256" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 84.6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	growth in the total number of miles driven per vehicle per year; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="TBL257" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 84.6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	increased vehicle complexity.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM&nbsp;is a technology holding company that operates through three wholly owned subsidiaries; one based in the United States of America (&quot;US&quot;), MAM Software, Inc. (&ldquo;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM NA&rdquo;) which is located in Blue Bell, Pennsylvania, and two based in the UK, MAM Software Limited (&ldquo;MAM Ltd.&rdquo;) which is located in Tankersley, Barnsley,&nbsp;UK and Origin Software Solutions Ltd. (&quot;Origin&quot;)&nbsp;which is located in Bristol, UK (MAM Ltd. and Origin are collectively referred to as &ldquo;MAM UK&rdquo;).&nbsp; The subsidiaries operate independently from one another.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	M
</I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	AM UK
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM UK is a provider of softwa
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	re to the automotive aftermarket in the&nbsp;UK and Ireland. MAM UK&#39;s two primary software solutions are Autopart and Autowork.&nbsp;
</FONT>
	Autopart is designed for and targeted at parts store chains that seek to manage multiple locations and inventories on a single system for a regional area.&nbsp; It is also suited for managing single location franchisees or buying group members.&nbsp; Autowork is designed for and targeted at small single location automotive installers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM UK also provides customers in the UK Market and North America&nbsp;with a range of business to business (&quot;B2B&quot;) and business to consumer (&quot;B2C&quot;) e-commerce solutions for the automotive aftermarket.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<EM>
	MAM NA
</EM>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM NA sells two primary software solutions,&nbsp;VAST and Autopart. VAST specifically focuses on selling systems to the service and tire segment of the market, while Autopart focuses on the warehouse and jobber segment of the market
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Our Technologies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	All MAM programs are based on the Microsoft Windows family of operating systems.&nbsp; Each MAM program is fully compatible with the other MAM applications in its range, enabling them to be combined to create a fully integrated package.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our solutions are available as both &#39;on premise&#39; applications (sold via the traditional perpetual licensing model) and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&lsquo;cloud&rsquo; solutions that are delivered as a service over the Internet on a subscription basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ID="PGBK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT;">
<DIV ID="PGNUM" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	1
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE="NOSHADE" STYLE="BORDER: CURRENTCOLOR; BORDER-IMAGE: NONE; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0); PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0);">
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV ID="PGHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Many of our business management applications are now available as software as a service (&quot;SaaS&quot;) solutions, where software and associated data is centrally hosted on the cloud. Depending on
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	the complexity of the application, MAM SaaS solutions are deployed using &#39;cloud hosting&#39; or &#39;web application&#39; technology:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 65.54PX; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER;">
	&bull;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1628.45PX;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	SaaS cloud hosting
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	- single tenants accessing fully-managed virtual servers via thin client (terminal services) connections (
<I>
	e.g.
</I>
	Autopart Online).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 65.54PX; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER;">
	&bull;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1628.45PX;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	SaaS web application
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	- multiple tenants accessing a dedicated website using a standard web browser (
<I>
	e.g.
</I>
	Autowork Online).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our catalog information is also available in the cloud as data as a service (&quot;DaaS&quot;). We centrally host and maintain the data, which
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	is accessed by users via a desktop application, web application or integrated into their business-to-consumer (B2C) website.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Market&nbsp;acceptance of cloud computing
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	for mission critical enterprise applications has become increasingly common in recent years.&nbsp; Now, software can be delivered cost-effectively, reliably, and securely to businesses over the Internet without the need for these businesses to either&nbsp;purchase supporting software and hardware for an on premise system or the need to keep IT people on staff to monitor and upgrade such a system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We introduced our first subscription-based service solution over the Internet in 2005 to customers&nbsp;in the UK Market, and we began marketing our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	first cloud system to customers in North America in 2013. Since that time, we have significantly expanded our cloud-based offerings and are offering customers that maintain in-house installations significant incentives to move to our cloud-computing model. While transitioning our&nbsp;customers to a cloud computing model results in a decrease in our up-front revenue recognition, we believe that this is a necessary transition and is in the best interests of our customers and our own long-term business prospects as an increasing number of our customers are looking for solutions that are highly functional, easy to use, configurable, and fast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our cloud model is based on Microsoft .Net, HTML5 and SQL technologies that are both open and secure, with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	support for user experiences on both desktop and mobile devices. Our customers that have moved away from traditional on premise software to our cloud-based service applications benefit by substantially reducing the complexity typical of on premise software implementations, customizations, and upgrades. Through cloud computing, we supply and manage the hardware, infrastructure, ongoing maintenance, and backup services for our customers. We install the latest version of our software for our customers, thereby reducing their need to buy and maintain their own IT resources. As a part of our cloud model, we also provide activation and training services to our customers as well as support services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Products and Services
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Meeting the needs of the automotive aftermarket requires a combination of business management systems, information products and online services that combine to deliver benefits for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	all parties involved in the timely repair of a vehicle.&nbsp;MAM provides systems and services that meet these needs and help its customers to meet their customers&rsquo; expectations. These products and services include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">

	1.
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
<B>
	Business Management Systems
</B>
</I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	comprised of&nbsp;our proprietary software applications, implementation and training and third-party hardware and peripherals;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</I>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">

	&nbsp;

	2.

</TD>

<B>
	Information Products
</B>
</I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	such as an accessible catalog database related to parts, tires, labor estimates, scheduled maintenance, repair information, technical service bulletins, pricing and product features and benefits that are used by the different participants in the automotive aftermarket;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	3.
</P>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	and products that provide online connectivity between manufacturers, warehouse distributors, retailers and automotive service providers. These products enable electronic data interchange throughout the automotive aftermarket supply chain between the different trading partners. They also enable procurement and business services to be projected over the Internet to an expanded business audience; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
