<B>
	Item 7.
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Management Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	The following discussion and analysis of the results of operations and financial condition is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2016, and June 30, 2015, and should be read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements, and the notes to those consolidated financial statements that are included elsewhere in this Report.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Our discussion
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	includes forward-looking statements based upon current expectations that involve risks and uncertainties, such as our plans, objectives, expectations and intentions. Actual results and the timing of events could differ materially from those anticipated in these forward-looking statements as a result of a number of factors, including those set forth under the &ldquo;Risk Factors,&rdquo; &ldquo;Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements&rdquo; and &ldquo;Business&rdquo; sections in this Report. We use words such as &ldquo;anticipate,&rdquo; &ldquo;estimate,&rdquo; &ldquo;plan,&rdquo; &ldquo;project,&rdquo; &ldquo;continuing,&rdquo; &ldquo;ongoing,&rdquo; &ldquo;expect,&rdquo; &ldquo;believe,&rdquo; &ldquo;intend,&rdquo; &ldquo;may,&rdquo; &ldquo;will,&rdquo; &ldquo;should,&rdquo; &ldquo;could,&rdquo; and similar expressions to identify forward-looking statements.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Unless the context indicates or requires otherwise, (i) the term &ldquo;MAM&rdquo; refers to MAM Software Group, Inc. and its principal operating subsidiaries; (ii) the term &ldquo;MAM Ltd.&rdquo; refers to MAM Software Limited; (iii) the term &ldquo;MAM NA&rdquo; refers to MAM Software, Inc.; (iv) the term &ldquo;Origin&rdquo; refers to Origin Software Solutions, Ltd.; (v) the term &ldquo;MAM UK&rdquo; collectively refers to MAM Ltd. And Origin; and (vi) the terms &ldquo;we,&rdquo; &ldquo;our,&rdquo; &ldquo;ours,&rdquo; and &ldquo;us&rdquo;&nbsp;refer collectively to MAM Software Group, Inc.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM Software Group, Inc.&nbsp;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	is a&nbsp;leading provider of cloud-based business and on premise management solutions for the auto parts, tires and vertical distribution industries.&nbsp;We have a broad line of software solutions and services to address the information technology (&quot;IT&quot;) needs of virtually every significant sector of the automotive aftermarket in the United Kingdom (&quot;UK&quot;) and Ireland (collectively referred to as the &ldquo;UK Market&rdquo;) and North America (&ldquo;NA&rdquo;), which includes the United States (&quot;US&quot;) and Canada,&nbsp;and are seeking to leverage this position into new industry verticals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	MAM NA has two primary software solutions, VAST and Autopart. We have and continue to market and develop business management software solutions that manage both the business and supp
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	ly chain for small- and medium-sized firms in the automotive aftermarket. The automotive aftermarket includes those businesses that supply servicing, parts, oil, tires, and performance extras to the retail market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ID="PGBK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT;">
<DIV ID="PGNUM" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	16
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE="NOSHADE" STYLE="BORDER: CURRENTCOLOR; BORDER-IMAGE: NONE; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0); PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0);">
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<DIV ID="PGHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our revenues and income are derived primarily from the sale of business management software, data, ecommerce
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	solutions and services and support. For MAM UK, we also earn a percentage of our revenue and income from the sale of hardware systems to clients.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the year ended June 30, 2016, we generated revenues of $32.2&nbsp;million&nbsp;and had net income of $3.6 million; 71% of these revenues came from the&nbsp;UK market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We are headquartered in Tankersley, Barnsley,&nbsp;UK and maintain additional offices for our NA operations in Blue Bell and Allentown, Pennsylvania, and, for our&nbsp;UK Market operations, in Northampton and Wareh
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	am. The software that we sell is Microsoft Windows&trade; based technology. The four main products that we support in the&nbsp;US cover all of the components of the automotive aftermarket supply chain. First is &ldquo;warehouse distribution.&rdquo; Into this market we sell our Autopart product to new prospects.&nbsp;&nbsp;Autopart enables large warehouses with hundreds of thousands of stock keeping units (&quot;SKU&quot;) to locate, manage, pack and deliver the parts with ease and efficiency. Second, these parts are distributed to the next business in the chain, which is the &ldquo;jobber.&rdquo; Into this market segment we also sell our Autopart product, which manages a jobber&rsquo;s business (i.e., financial, stock control and order management) but more importantly enables the jobber to quickly identify the parts that the jobber&rsquo;s client needs, either via the Internet or telephone, so that the correct product for the vehicle on the ramp can be supplied. The third and next segment of the automotive aftermarket supply chain is the &ldquo;installer,&rdquo; which repairs and maintains automobiles. The installer needs systems that enable it to efficiently and simply manage his businesses, whether as a single entity or national multi-site franchise. Into this segment we sell VAST and Autowork Online. The fourth segment is the &ldquo;OpenWebs&trade;.&rdquo; This technology allows these separate business solutions to connect to each other to allow, among other processes, ordering, invoicing and stock checking to take place in real- time both up and down the supply chain. The&nbsp;UK Market differs from that of the&nbsp;US in that it does not have the same number of large warehouse distribution centers. In the&nbsp;UK Market we sell the Autopart product to the jobber market, but sell Autowork Online to the installer market.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the UK, we also sell our catalog solution, Autocat+, which is an Internet-based identification tool&nbsp;used by the warehouse distribution, jobber and installer
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Current
</B>
<STRONG>
	Products and Services
</STRONG>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Meeting the needs of the automotive aftermarket requires offering a combination of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	business management systems, information products and online services that combine to deliver benefits for all parties involved in the timely repair of a vehicle. Our products and services include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Business management systems comprised of our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	proprietary software applications, implementation and training and third-party hardware and peripherals;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 216PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Information products such as an accessible catalog database related to parts, tires, labor estimates, scheduled maintenance, repair information,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	technical service bulletins, pricing and product features and benefits, which are&nbsp;used by the different participants in the automotive aftermarket;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Online services and products that connect manufacturers, warehouse distributors, retailers and auto
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	motive service providers via the Internet. These products enable electronic data interchange throughout the automotive aftermarket supply chain among the different trading partners. They also enable procurement and business services to be projected over the Internet to an expanded business audience. Some&nbsp;clients&nbsp;use our information products on their own websites and intranets and some clients use our systems and branded software to obtain relevant and up-to-date information&nbsp;via the Internet; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Customer support and consulting services that provide phone and online support, implementation and training.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ID="PGBK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT;">
<DIV ID="PGNUM" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	17
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE="NOSHADE" STYLE="BORDER: CURRENTCOLOR; BORDER-IMAGE: NONE; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0); PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0);">
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<DIV ID="PGHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
<B>
	Need for Technology Solutions
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	A variety of factors drive the automotive market
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&rsquo;s need for sophisticated technology solutions, including the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Inventory Management
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Industry sources suggest that approximately 35% of parts produced are never sold and 30% of parts stocked are never sold. Approximately 25% of parts sold are eventually r
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	eturned due to insufficient knowledge or capability by either the parts supplier counterman or the auto service provider installer. Clearly, there is substantial inefficiency in the automotive aftermarket supply chain. This inefficiency results in excess inventory carrying costs, logistical costs and the over-production of parts and tires at the manufacturer level. The combination of business systems software, information products, and connectivity services we offer. can assist in overcoming these inefficiencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	C
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	ompetition
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	In the US, the need for technology solutions has been accelerated by the expansion of large specialty parts retailers such as AutoZone,&nbsp;Inc. and&nbsp;Advance Auto Parts, Inc. and large auto service chains like Monro, Muffler and Brake, Inc. This expansion has drive
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	n smaller competitors to computerize or upgrade their existing systems with more modern business management solutions enabled for information products and online services. Many of the systems&nbsp;used by smaller competitors today are older, character-based or systems developed in-house that have a limited ability to integrate current information products and online services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Volume and Complexity of Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Businesses in the automotive aftermarket manage large volumes of information from numerous
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	sources with complex inter-relationships. There are over 4.5 million different&nbsp;SKU available to parts sellers in the product catalogs used by the&nbsp;US automotive aftermarket. The numbers of SKU increase in the order of some 5% each year. Moreover, manufacturers update product information and product prices with increasing frequency as they improve their internal processing and try to keep pace with consumer trends. As a result, most automotive aftermarket businesses require sophisticated inventory management systems, accurate and timely information on parts, tires, and repair delivered through online services to communicate, manage and present this volume of data effectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Customer Service Requirements
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Consumer demand for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	same-day repair service and the need to maintain efficient use of repair bays, forces automotive service providers to demand prompt and accurate delivery of specific parts and tires from their suppliers. Getting the required product promptly depends on all the parties having access to timely information about product price and availability. To meet these demanding customer service requirements successfully, automotive aftermarket participants need business management systems, product information and online services that enable workers to reliably and accurately transact their business between warehouse distributors, parts stores and automotive service providers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
	Regional Efficiencies
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The use and availability of a combination of business management system
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	s, information products and online services has resulted in the development of regional trading networks among auto service provider chains, stores and warehouse distributors of parts and tires. This enables participants to achieve the efficiencies and customer service levels that are critical to being competitive and successful against the larger retail and service chains in the automotive aftermarket.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<I>
<B>
	Plans for Growth
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We expect growth in the automotive aftermarket will continue to be driven by:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX;">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	gradual growth in the aggregate number of vehicles in
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;use;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	an increase in the average age of vehicles in operation;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	growth in the total number of miles driven per vehicle per year; and
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP;">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&bull;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0.8PT 0PT 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	increased vehicle complexity.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ID="PGBK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT;">
<DIV ID="PGNUM" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	18
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE="NOSHADE" STYLE="BORDER: CURRENTCOLOR; BORDER-IMAGE: NONE; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0); PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0);">
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
<DIV ID="PGHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We see opportunities to expand the breadth of our customer base within the automotive industry and diversify into new industries with similarly complex needs. We offer tailored business management and distribution software to the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	wholesale distributor market of the automotive industry. We have also started to expand and diversify our client and product mix in the&nbsp;UK Market&nbsp;to serve the lumber and hardware industries, which we believe have an unmet need for the efficiency offered by our suite of business software solutions and services. Our growth plans include adapting and updating our software products to serve other vertical markets as well as through potential acquisitions. While we have identified these vertical markets for potential growth for our software, our top execution priority remains automotive projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	To date, our management has identified five areas of focus to drive our business.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;The first area is the continued growth of SaaS revenues derived from delivering our business management software via the &lsquo;cloud&rsquo;.&nbsp;&nbsp;At present, most of our customers have our software installed in-house.&nbsp; However, market acceptance of cloud computing for mission critical enterprise applications has become increasingly common in recent years since software can be delivered cost-effectively, reliably, and securely to&nbsp;businesses over the Internet without the need for these businesses to purchase supporting software and hardware for&nbsp;an on premise system or&nbsp;the need to keep information technology personnel on staff&nbsp;to monitor and upgrade such a system.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We introduced our first subscription-based service solution over the Internet in 2005 in the UK Market, and we began marketing
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	our first cloud system to customers in North America in 2013. Since that time, we have significantly expanded our cloud-based offerings and are offering customers that maintain in-house installations significant incentives to move to our cloud-computing model. While transitioning our MAM&nbsp;UK customers to a cloud computing model results in a decrease in our up-front revenue recognition, we believe that this is a necessary transition and is in the best interests of our customers and our own long-term business prospects as an increasing number of our customers are looking for solutions that are highly functional, easy to use, configurable, and fast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	To date, Autowork Online, our &quot;installer&quot; solution in the UK Market and Autopart Online, our parts store solution, are being delivered in this way.&nbsp; Both products have been developed under the &#39;cloud&#39; computing model.&nbsp; This is where software solutions are made available to end-users via the Internet and does not require them to purchase the software directly, but &#39;rent&#39; it over a fixed period of time.&nbsp; We believe that this will be a growing area in the UK and NA markets as businesses continue to look for ways of reducing capital expenditures while maintaining levels of service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Autowork Online was launched&nbsp;in 2010 and as of June 30, 2016 we had&nbsp;2,865 customers subscribing to this service.&nbsp;&nbsp;A white label&nbsp;version&nbsp;of this product
</FONT>
	, which is our product rebranded by a different company,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;has been successfully launched into the&nbsp;NA market in conjunction with ALLDATA LLC. Autopart Online was launched in August 2011 in the&nbsp;UK Market&nbsp;and in 2014 in the&nbsp;NA.&nbsp; As of June 30, 2016 we had 3,191 end users subscribing to this service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We have been developing VAST Online, the &#39;cloud&#39; version of our VAST platform, which we expect to launch in the second half of fiscal year 2017.&nbsp; We have been working with Goodyear to deliver a version of VAST Online that will be their next generation point of sale &#39;cloud&#39; solution.&nbsp; Following the successful rollout of VAST Online to the Goodyear network, MAM NA will promote the product to the wider NA market and also in the UK market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The second area of focus is the sales and marketing strategy within the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;NA market. MAM NA business will continue to invest in sales and marketing activity to help further expand the MAM brand and build our pipeline in the&nbsp;NA market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The third area of focus relates to the launch of our information service, Autocat+, an electronic auto parts catalog that uses the DaaS distribution model.&nbsp; MAM centrally hosts and maintains the data, which is accessed by users&nbsp;via MAM&#39;s business management software, a standalone desktop application, or web application.&nbsp; Data can also be &#39;consumed&#39; via a web service for integration into B2C websites.&nbsp; Information in Autocat+ is maintained through an automatic verification and standardization process, with updates published daily.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	In the UK Market, there are approximately 10,000 end-users (warehouse distributors, parts stores and auto service providers)&nbsp;of our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	information products,&nbsp;to whom&nbsp;a monthly or annual subscription fee is charged. Our management believes that launching a&nbsp;version of Autocat+ in the NA market will boost sales of our related our business management software solutions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The fourth area&nbsp;of focus is&nbsp;to sust
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	ain levels of growth in MAM UK by concentrating on vertical markets, which share common issues to that of the automotive market. We have developed a reputation of high levels of service and knowledge within the automotive market, and we are now working on replicating this reputation in these additional vertical markets.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	The fifth area of focus is the continued investment in research and development that allows us to deliver innovative new solutions and modules in the four prior areas of focus.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	During the year ended June 30, 2016, we introduced a number of enhancements to our existing products which created additional value for existing and prospective customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Additional Vertical Markets: Plumbing Merchants, Electrical Wholesalers, Builders Merchants and Lumber Merchants
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We believe that construction-related businesses would
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	benefit from the business management and distribution systems developed by MAM for its customers in the automotive aftermarket. We already have over 80 clients in the&nbsp;UK Market operating in the plumbing, building, lumber, and electrical wholesale distribution markets that are using a derivative of MAM&#39;s Autopart product, known as &ldquo;Trader.&rdquo; We originally moved the Autopart product into these additional vertical markets a number of years ago after being approached by companies operating within these vertical markets that could not find a suitable management solution. To date, these additional vertical markets have made only a limited contribution to the revenues of MAM Ltd.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We hav
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	e been promoting the &ldquo;Trader&rdquo; product to these markets, specifically targeting small and medium sized businesses with revenues of between $500,000 and $10 million. We are, and intend to continue,&nbsp;promoting Trader&nbsp;through a number of channels,&nbsp;direct marketing, advertorials and trade shows. We are also looking to raise awareness of the Trader product by placing advertisements in&nbsp;trade journals and will continue to look to have articles and editorial reviews written about the product and its advantages for those operating within these markets. We have also been targeting small and medium sized businesses within these vertical markets with direct mail pieces such as product fliers, and case studies from the small client base we have in this market. These have then been followed up by MAM&rsquo;s existing internal sales team to generate qualified leads for the external sales representatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Given the current opportunities in the automotive market, and the resources required to ensure the successful development and launch of several major projects, exploring additional vertical markets has been a lower strategic priority during the year ended June 30, 2016.&nbsp; We will continue to monitor the market and generate a reasonable amount of new interest in this area.&nbsp; During the year ended June 30, 2017, we expect this area of our business to be a greater part of our strategic discussions; however, at this time, we remain focused on executing on our present and near-term project commitments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Strategic Goals
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We are looking to increase our share of the&nbsp;NA market by (i) increasing the sales and marketing presence of our Autopart prod
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	uct, (ii) focusing on the tire and&nbsp;service&nbsp;and repair sector&nbsp;of the market (iii) and establishing Autocat and OpenWebs&trade; as the e-commerce standard within the Automotive market. In the&nbsp;UK Market we expect to continue to grow our market share through (i) moving our business management software into new vertical markets and&nbsp;(ii) increasing our footprint within the automotive aftermarket.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	We believe that our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;successful experience within the automotive market will translate well into other vertical markets that have similarly complex supply chains. By developing specific sales teams with relevant market experience and supporting with them suitable marketing collateral, we believe that over time &ldquo;Trader&rdquo; can become an established product offering in these vertical markets.&nbsp;We plan, at this stage, to focus only on the&nbsp;UK Market for these additional vertical market opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	Impact of Currency Exchange Rate
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Our net revenue derived from sales in curr
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	encies other than the&nbsp;US dollar was 71% and 74% for the years ended&nbsp;June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As the&nbsp;US dollar strengthens in relation to the Great Britain Pound (&ldquo;GBP&rdquo;),&nbsp;our revenue and income, which is reported in&nbsp;US dollars, is negatively impacted.&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in the currency values occur regularly and in some instances may have a significant effect on our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Income and expenses of MAM UK are translated at the average exchange rate.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;The exchange rate for MAM UK&rsquo;s operating results was US $1.48357 per GBP for the year ended June 30, 2016, as compared to US $1.5755 per GBP for the year ended June 30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Assets and liabilities of MAM UK are translated into&nbsp;US dollars at the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	period-end exchange rates.&nbsp;&nbsp;The exchange rate used for translating assets and liabilities of MAM UK was&nbsp;US $1.33898 per GBP at June 30, 2016, as compared to US $1.5717 per GBP at June 30, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Currency translation income (loss) adjustments are accumulated as a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	separate component of stockholders&rsquo; equity, which totaled ($3.0) million and ($1.2) million&nbsp;as of June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<STRONG>
	Deferred Revenue
</STRONG>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Quarterly and annual revenues are impacted by the deferral of revenue related to implementation and installation charges for SaaS contracts.&nbsp; The expectation is that there will be a continued shift to the cloud-based version of our products from our perpetual license products and that the associated revenue will shift from being recognized at the time of the transaction to being recognized over the customer life.&nbsp; However, as we will continue to offer perpetual license products, we cannot fully anticipate how revenue will be impacted.&nbsp; As of June 30, 2016, deferred revenue was $1.2 million.&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ID="PGBK" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT;">
<DIV ID="PGNUM" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	19
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE="NOSHADE" STYLE="BORDER: CURRENTCOLOR; BORDER-IMAGE: NONE; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0); PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(0, 0, 0);">
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<DIV ID="PGHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Total net revenues increased $2.0 million, partially offset by unfavorable foreign currency exchange rates movements of $1.4 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Net revenues from our MAM UK operations decreased primarily as a result of unfavorable&nbsp;foreign currency exchange rate movements&nbsp;of $1.4 million.&nbsp; This was offset by increases in recurring revenues of $1.9 million and decreases in systems sales of $1.2 million.&nbsp; The increase in recurring revenue and decrease in system sales are attributed to customers moving to our SaaS platform.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Net revenues from our MAM&nbsp;NA operations increased for recurring and system sales as a result of overall growth in the market for SaaS and perpetual license sales and professional services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	Cost of revenues increased&nbsp;$1.4 million due to increases in professional services headcount to support growth as well as increases in license costs.&nbsp; This increase was offset by favorable foreign currency rate movements of $0.6 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
